comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content:
The picture seems was taken before 1905 (see beside right to propiedad asegurada [1904]), because Mr. Federico Wulff house (now a days known as "La Casa del Cerro Museum") construction was over in that year (1905); on the top of La Durangueña Hill, in the farthest south-west of Torreón.  The camera is facing north, below the horizon line is Nazas River which divides the cities of Torreón, in Coahuila State from Gómez Palacio, in Durango State. This picture shows the house still under construction.  Many Waite's photos numbered 1000 and on were taken/published in 1904. Mr. Wulff traced the first map (grid) of the city of Torreón in november 1887. Besides, Hotel San Carlos is not seen yet, its back was across the street from Mr. Andrés Eppen house.
Dr. Roberto Duarte
Cirujano Plástico
Torreón, Coahuila, México
